intro: Peucedanum caledonicum, commonly known as the Scottish cow-wheat, is a flowering plant native to the Scottish Highlands. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils and thrives in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Its fruits are small, dry schizocarps that release tiny seeds when mature. Peucedanum caledonicum is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and historical significance in Scottish flora.
